result.execSummary:
The defendant Bailey F. Plonsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- stayed 
If revoked, may serve with huber and 50% may be served on GPS or Electronic monitor, if approved by jail and assessment.
Concurrent with: with 15CM210

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bailey F. Plonsky
Current: 3232 Echo Dells, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2017)
Prior: 18010 Nicholas Road, Plattsmouth, NE 68048 United States

9:09 a.m. Defendant Bailey F. Plonsky in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM210 and 15CM378.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 I/S Sentence: 120 days jail - stay and 18 Probation w/conditions for both cases.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM210: No Contest
15CM378: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM210 and 15CM378.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Victims were given notification and are not present.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:*******PROBATION****
15CM210 943.50(1m)(b) Retail Theft:
I/S Sentence: 120 days jail - stayed with huber and 50% may be served on GPS or Electronic monitor, if approved by jail and assessment. 2 days credit. 
 18 mo Probation:
Conditions:
No contact or be on the premises of Walmart.
No contact or be on the premises of Copps, unless approved by Agent.
Participate in any counseling, assessment, or evaluations recommended by the agent.  
Pay costs + DNA surcharges

15CM378 943.50(1m)(b) Retail Theft:
120 days jail - stayed with huber and 50% may be served on GPS or Electronic monitor, if approved by jail and assessment. 2 days credit
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CM210.
Same conditions as 15CM210
Restitution $38.94.
Pay costs + DNA surcharges

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:40 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  The defendant has moved to another state just this week.  Has been speaking with Atty Cousins.  Requests to schedule for a status conference so they can continue with negotations.  
Atty Cousins asks for the new address. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.

Prior: 215 Sherman Avenue E27, Stevens Point, WI 54481
